etymologies: mid 19th century: propionic from French propionique, from Greek pro ‘before’ + piōn ‘fat’, it being the first member of the fatty acid series to form fats

definitions: a colorless pungent liquid organic acid produced in some forms of fermentation and used for inhibiting the growth of mold in bread.

notes.text: Alternative name: propanoic acid; chemical formula: C₂H₅COOH

shortDefinitions: colourless pungent liquid organic acid produced in some forms of fermentation
